channel.title: Gtl votes [help please]
channel.description:
I'm stuck with these two images. For the Installation part what do I put? This is what I think, but correct me if I'm wrong please.
- My no-ip - same username for me to log in on my cpanel - same password for my cpanel log in - (server name)_votes; Example: runeserver_votes
Please help me as I cannot get this somewhat right please. Also, are they all Case sensitive? Please tell me which ones are. Thnkx. One more thing, I'm sure I'm missing things to add here. Add my skype please: kk_killah Find the name Paradox. [spoiler=this][IMG]http://imagizer.imageshack.us/v2/xq90/538/driDdD.png[/img] [IMG]http://imagizer.imageshack.us/v2/xq90/537/6KK3gL.png[/img] [IMG]http://imagizer.imageshack.us/v2/xq90/661/MtBPAN.png[/img][/spoiler]

item.title: Gtl votes [help please]
item.dc:creator: @imback4more imback4more
item.description:
@imback4more wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:15, topic:547249”][quote author=imback4more link=topic=666154.msg4453683#msg4453683 date=1413303598]

What is a callback link and how do I do this? And where exactly do I buy the remote mysql at?
Also, what would be the range of cost in USD for the remote mysql?

Remote MySQL isn’t a feature that’s sold separately… Like I said, it depends per webhost.
Here’s a few:
http://000webhost.com
http://x10premium.com (premium of: http://x10hosting.com )
http://hostgator.com
http://1and1.com

I have hostgator, I added my no-ip to the remote mysql, everything still does the same. What is the next step to do for this?

Like I said, it’s probably a paid feature.

If you’re having an issue with remote mysql, talk to the host company (hostgator), they’ll be able to fix it.
[/quote]Ok, now heres my new problem. Btw Thank you so much so far. Greatly appreciated by you.

A player of mine tested the votes he did ::vote, clicked on the voting forum. Did the code from the voting forum, Successfully voted, went back to the vote page, clicked Continue button. Then says you need to vote on all links at the top of the page in red. And his data for voting has shown up, but is in the failed_votes section. Rather than the has_voted section. What’s up with that?

Could be he didn’t actually do all the links, and then the time expired for him (idk what they have the timer set to, if any).
Or you still have an issue with your callbacks.
Or there was a communication error between the vote site and your site. Hard to tell from 1 single image.[/quote]Can you add me on skype please? You know the your stuff man and I need your help. Skype name: kk_killah, look for the name paradox. Thnkx.

Read full topic

item.title: Gtl votes [help please]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Image issue:
Probably an issue with your callback links. Double check that they’re correct.

::claim issue:
Right now, your current error is because you didn’t edit the SQL information on your server. In Server.java, where you have the vote constructor (Something like “public static MainLoader vote = new MainLoader(DATABASE_IP, DATABASE_USER, USER_PASS, DATABASE_NAME);”) is your error.
You need to replace the information with the information you just got from your host (like localhost and etc, all the stuff we used for: http://imagizer.imageshack.us/v2/xq90/537/6KK3gL.png ).
EXCEPT the IP address will not be “localhost”.

This is why you need remote MySQL. And to answer your question on that. You buy the feature from your webhost. It is not a feature you can just download or install. They need to activate/allow it.
I can’t say how much it costs or anything, as it varies per host. But it will typically be included in any monthly plan.

Read full topic

item.title: Gtl votes [help please]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

You will need remote mysql, which with most webhosts is a paid service. The votes will work without it, but the server can’t connect to the database, so no one will be able to claim anything.

Read full topic

Whenever no one helps me, I come here and the questions are mostly being answered unlike other forums out there.
You explained this very thoroughly. If I ever need help again, I’ll come here and post it up. Thnkx.

Read full topic

item.title: Gtl votes [help please]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Have you heard of MySQL? Yeah, that’s what you’re using.
Chances are your website has phpmyadmin and all that installed on the same server as your website, so the “Database address” will be “localhost”.
The database, you must setup yourself.

So in cPanel, find phpMyAdmin, there should be some database tools near it:

Open the first application. It’ll take you to a page with some (depending) databases and etc.
There will be a gray box that says "create a new database"
put a name in for the database, and then hit create.

After it creates, go back to that page. Scroll down.

There’s a section to "Add new MySQL users"
Create one.
remember the information, as you’ll be using it shortly.

Next, after the user is made. Add it to the database. On the same page, a bit under where you created the user is the “Add User To Database” section. First, select your user in the first drop down. In the second dropdown, select the database you just made.
Hit add, it’ll take you to a new page to select what permissions to give the user. Just give it all permissions.

Now you’ve got your database.
Time to use it.

Database username is the user you just created (Most webhosts add some form of a name extension to the beginning of the usernames/databases. Ex: my site adds “canyourc_” to the start of each, so if i made the account “admin” it would be “canyourc_admin”).
The password, is the pass for the user.

And of course, the database name is the database we just made.

Read full topic
